levels.title: Move to Line Start (0)
levels.description: Move the cursor to the start of the current line.
levels.hint: Use the <kbd>0</kbd> key to jump to the start of the line.

levels.title: Move to Line End ($
levels.description: Move the cursor to the end of the current line.
levels.hint: Use the <kbd>$</kbd> key to jump to the end of the line.

levels.title: Move Up/Down (j, k)
levels.description: Move the cursor from the first line to the line containing "Second line".
levels.hint: Use <kbd>j</kbd> to move down a line and <kbd>k</kbd> to move up.

levels.title: Next Word Start (w)
levels.description: The cursor is on 'T' in "The". Use w to move to the start of the word "quick".
levels.hint: Press w to move to the start of the next word.

levels.title: Go to First Line (gg)
levels.description: You are on the third line. Go to the first line using gg.
levels.hint: Press g twice (gg) to go to the first line of the file.

levels.title: Go to Last Line (G)
levels.description: You are on the second line. Go to the last line of this file using G.
levels.hint: Press Shift+g (which is G) to go to the last line of the file.

levels.title: Counted Movement Down (3j)
levels.description: Move down 3 lines from "Line one" to reach "Line four" using a count with j.
levels.hint: Type 3 then j (3j) to move down 3 lines.

levels.title: Previous Word Start (b)
levels.description: Cursor is on 'b' in "brown". Use b to move to the start of the word "quick".
levels.hint: Press b to move to the start of the previous word.

levels.title: Next Word End (e)
levels.description: Cursor is on 'q' in "quick". Use e to move to the end of "quick" (the 'k').
levels.hint: Press e to move to the end of the current or next word.

levels.title: Counted Word Forward (2w)
levels.description: From "The", move forward two words to land on "brown" using 2w.
levels.hint: Type 2 then w (2w) to jump forward two words.

levels.title: Delete Character (x)
levels.description: Delete the letter 'X' from the word "teXt". The cursor starts on 'X'.
levels.hint: Place the cursor on the character you want to delete and press <kbd>x</kbd>.
